data.title: ccui.Text在win32平台不会自动换行
Fix pageview iterator invalidation
data.body: This PR fixes a regression introduced by my pull request #18059. When dynamically adding or removing pages from the PageView, the indicator nodes had an issue with iterator invalidation. That's my mistake.

data.title: Node::setOpacity renders desktop when android:theme is set to Theme.Translucent.NoTitleBar
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: bug reproduced on 3.3 and 3.15. All 3.x versions seem to have this problem.
- devices test on: Redmi Note 4x
- developing environments
   - NDK version: android-ndk-r10d
   - Android SDK version: android-19

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a cpp project
2. Change theme to Theme.Translucent.NoTitleBar
3. add a LayerColor(255, 0, 0, 128) with opacity 128 to HelloWorldScene:
addChild(LayerColor::create(ccColor4B(255, 0, 0, 128)));
4. Build an Android apk.
![setOpacity Bug](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wayne5ning/share/master/cocos2dx/setOpacity_Bug.png)

data.title: notificationNode appears to be zoom out to a half in my retina mbp
make RichText supports img tag with Sprite Frame name
data.body: this feature is added to support Creator editor because Creator only supports img tag using sprite frame from texture atlas

data.title: Avoid unnecessary file reads and parsing if plist file isn't loaded in SpriteFrameCache.
data.body: This is just a small performance improvement I found when cleaning up several spritesheets during context switching (from gameplay to menus and vice-versa).

data.title: Fix polygon sprite bug of resetting flip and color information
data.body:
Fix polygon sprite (`CCSprite`) bug of resetting flip and color information when `setSpriteFrame(SpriteFrame *spriteFrame)` is called.

This pull request fixes issue #15696.

data.title: fix iOS deltatime
data.body: related issue: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/18072

data.title: Fix AudioEngine thread concurrency crash
data.body:
Fix `AudioEngine` thread concurrency crash between `myAlSourceNotificationCallback(ALuint sid, ALuint notificationID, ALvoid* userData)` and `_play2d(AudioCache *cache, int audioID)` when iterating over `_audioPlayers` instance variable.

This crash happens when you have multiple audio tracks running at the same time and frequently call `_play2d(AudioCache *cache, int audioID)`.

data.title: inconsistant delta value from "void update(float delta)" when app is back active in Release mode.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: different  iOS devices  with different iOS versions
- developing environments : Xcode Version 8.3.3 (8E3004b)

If you open the notification center, the app is paused (music still working).
If you close if few seconds layer, the app is resumed.

This is good and works as expected when compiled in Debug mode but there is a problem in Release mode.

In Release mode the current animations are not resumed correctly, and are usually directly ended.
This is because the elapsed time (while the notification center was displayed) is taken into account in Release mode (but not in Debug mode).

We can see the same problem with the delta time value from the update(float delta) method (triggered when scheduleUpdate has been performed).

The first frame (the first update(float delta) call), after the app is back active (the notification center being hidden), will have a usual low value (e.g .01s) in Debug mode, but will have a high value (e.g 5s) in release mode, according to the time spent while paused.

data.title: Using etc1 with alpha pic to create a sprite, After set the sprite to gray shader, the alpha channel will lost
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cur v3 branch
- devices test on: win32

```
    display.loadSpriteFrames("UI/common/res_common.plist")
    
    local a = display.newSprite("#UI/common/comon_10.png")
        :addTo(display.getRunningScene())
        :move(display.center)
        :setAnchorPoint(display.CENTER_BOTTOM)
        :setScale(1)

    -- set gray shader
    local function getStringFromFile(path) return cc.FileUtils:getInstance():getStringFromFile(path) end
    local grayArrays = cc.GLProgram:createWithByteArrays(getStringFromFile("res/gl/default.vsh"), getStringFromFile("res/gl/gray.fsh"))
    local gray = cc.GLProgramState:getOrCreateWithGLProgram(grayArrays)
    a:setGLProgramState(gray)
```
Before I set the gray shader, the sprite is normal,
After I set the gray shader, the sprite lost the alpha channel.

data.title: add ui/gl thread helper methods for windows 10 platform.
use VAO/VBO to improve performance
Fix ui slice issue
data.body: fix issue: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17654

data.title: Fixed typo. Added comments about GLFW 3.3 controller support.
data.body:
No code changes in this pull request. Only comments.

GLFW recently added [gamepad](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/commit/953106e74ddaf925eb2d100ea67bb36bf89167d4) support. Once it's bundled with cocos2d-x, we just have to map those gamepad keys from GFLW to `Controller::Key` key codes. I just added reminders about the changes that need to be made.

GLFW will provide support for more controllers than the ones currently added to `CCController-linux-win32.cpp` by using the [SDL game controller database](https://github.com/gabomdq/SDL_GameControllerDB) and providing a unified input key codes similar to `Controller::Key`.

data.title: Moved GLFWEventHandler to its corresponding header
data.body:
There are no explicit changes in this pull request other than exposing `GLFWEventHandler`, but if this pull request gets accepted I think it will have an important implication to Cocos2D-X developers for at least one use case that I have in mind: attaching an alternative UI library for providing an in-game editor.

Without this change there's no easy way to pass raw glfw events to an alternative UI libraries such as [dear imgui](https://github.com/ocornut/imgui), while also passing events to `EventDistpatcher`. One way could be creating a whole new class based on `GLViewImpl` that passes those events to both: `dear imgui` and the `EventDispatcher` but doing that will prompt many unnecessary changes, unnecessary copy-paste that will affect maintainability and that can be avoided with just this pull request.

With this change it's easy to rewire the glfw events [like this](https://github.com/Rubonnek/cocos2d-x-imgui/blob/master/Classes/CCImGui/ImGuiManager.cpp#L216-L223) to [pass raw glfw events to both](https://github.com/Rubonnek/cocos2d-x-imgui/blob/master/Classes/CCImGui/ImGuiManager.cpp#L225-L247) `EventDispatcher` and `dear imgui`.

In the future, should cocos2d-x support webassembly, it will also allow developers to use their same in-game editor based on `dear imgui` (or any other UI library like [nuklear](https://github.com/vurtun/nuklear)) on the web too since there are currently examples of running `dear imgui` alone on the web. See the following live demos:

* [Demo1](https://rawgit.com/Flix01/imgui/2015-10-Addons/examples/addons_examples/html/main.html)
* [Demo2](https://rawgit.com/Flix01/imgui/2015-10-Addons/examples/addons_examples/html/main2.html)
* [Demo3](https://rawgit.com/Flix01/imgui/2015-10-Addons/examples/addons_examples/html/main3.html)
